conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric-style model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible room volumes, and ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable volumes; angled view is correct; cutaway is clean with minor simplification at some wall tops/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 3BHK layout and major zoning (living/dining central, bedrooms around, kitchen on right) largely matches, but at least one balcony/outer edge condition appears inconsistent (top-center balcony in 2D not clearly represented in 3D), and some partition lengths/door positions are simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Beds present in all bedrooms; dining table and some seating present; kitchen counters/appliances represented; bathrooms/toilets appear present but fixtures are simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with consistent materials and clean background; lighting is adequate; openings/windows visible though not all are dimensionally verifiable.

detected_errors.description: Balcony/cutout relationship differs: the 2D plan shows a prominent top-center balcony off the living/dining, which is not clearly present/expressed in the 3D model.
Door/window placements and opening sizes appear simplified; not all doors/windows can be confirmed to be on the exact walls as in the 2D plan.
Furniture is simplified and sparse relative to the plan; some room identities rely on assumed placement rather than explicit fixtures.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong 3D fundamentals and mostly faithful overall layout, but with notable mismatch in at least one balcony/edge condition and simplified openings.
